snippet: As sales droop in the staid center aisles full of shelf-stable products, grocers are focusing on more glamorous areas like the deli, bakery and produce sections.
abstract: Supermarkets are rethinking allocation of space, expanding the perimeter, as sales fall and shopping and eating patterns continue to change, threatening the food companies whose shelf-stable products have long filled the prominent center store area; areas like produce, bakery, deli, meat and seafood are occupying more space, a notable shift for grocery stores.
lead_paragraph: As sales droop in the staid center aisles full of shelf-stable products, grocers are focusing on more glamorous areas like the deli, bakery and produce sections.

headline.seo: In Grocery Stores, the Perimeters Take Center Stage
headline.main: In Grocery Stores, the Perimeters Take Center Stage
